name: nonchalance
description: The easiest way to augment DOM builtin elements

scripts.build: npm run build:all && npm run build:types && npm run cjs && npm run rollup && npm run types && npm run test && npm run size:all && npm run size:es && npm run size:runtime
scripts.rollup: rollup --config rollup/es.config.js && rollup --config rollup/runtime.config.js && rollup --config rollup/all.config.js
scripts.size:all: echo -e "\x1b[1mall.js\x1b[0m brotli $(cat all.js | brotli | wc -c)";echo -e "\x1b[1mall.js\x1b[0m gzip $(cat all.js | gzip | wc -c)"
scripts.size:es: echo -e "\x1b[1mes.js\x1b[0m brotli $(cat es.js | brotli | wc -c)";echo -e "\x1b[1mes.js\x1b[0m gzip $(cat es.js | gzip | wc -c)"
scripts.size:runtime: echo -e "\x1b[1mruntime.js\x1b[0m brotli $(cat runtime.js | brotli | wc -c)";echo -e "\x1b[1mruntime.js\x1b[0m gzip $(cat runtime.js | gzip | wc -c)"

author: Andrea Giammarchi
